pageContext.associations: May have been found with 2 broken spearheads from same parish and from this donor.
pageContext.publications: Presumably the "bronze palstave" mentioned by Mr. R. Ll. Kenyon in his "Pre-historic Shropshire",Shrops Arch. Trans. IV (2nd S.), p. 279,Anden, Vic. Co His. Shrops. I, p. 202
pageContext.collection: Shrewsbury Museum,donor H. R. Corbet, Esq.
pageContext.toSearch: Child's Ercall, Market Drayton, Shropshire Tf9, UK
pageContext.remarks: Shrewsbury Museum Donations Book I (MS) records that on July 29, 1886, H. Reg. Corbet, Esq. of Adderley, presented "1 Bronze Roman Celt, Found in the parish of Child's Ercall, Salop., 1858" and "1 Roman Bronze Spear or Banner head found at the same place."
